pkgmetadata.longdescription: For unknown reasons, ALSA libraries newer than that generated by >=media-libs/alsa-lib-1.0.28 instantly crash vmware products. At least, they do on someone's system, and since not many people run vmware anymore (one wonders why, since it works so well, for such a cheap price!) the aformentioned someone just assumed it's probably broken for everyone running a Gentoo ~amd64 system. This package provides an older (=media-libs/alsa-lib-1.0.27*-ish) ALSA library, tucked away, harmlessly, in a nonstandard location (/opt/vmware-libasound), which, when preloaded by a wrapper script, forestalls the crash, thereby probably costing you or your employer a thousand bucks a year, or so, and much, much stress, by allowing one to put off the inevitable migration to VirtualBox for just a little bit longer....
